task.summary: Solved issue when the click was not on the grid but on the child element in the matchGrid

Update layout, make region selection dynamic
Updated the UI layout by wrapping text elements in Viewbox for better text scaling. The region selection has also been made dynamic, enabling the selection of the desired game server in the Welcome page. The selected regional routes are passed as parameters throughout the application for better integration with RiotGamesApi. Changed the default server from NA to EUW to reflect the more frequent usage. These changes provide more flexibility to the user and improve the usability of the application.

Add routing info to summoner page navigation parameters
Two more navigation parameters - SummonerRegionalRoute and SummonerPlatformRoute - are added to support region and platform based routing. The diff also corrects the index of parameters in the MatchDetail page, aligning them with the new sequence. The changes aim to improve the navigation specificity and enhance the overall user experience.

Add visual indicators for Match Timeline events
Additional visual indicators such as circles and bars have been added to the match timeline to represent different in-game events like 'WARD_PLACED' and 'CHAMPION_KILL'. This change enhances user interaction and understanding of in-game events timeline, thereby improving the overall user experience.

Refactor MatchDetail.xaml.cs for readability and improved functionality
Switched the variable declarations for consistency and better readability. Also, fixed the color of ellipseRed to represent negative events. Further, improved the creation of an event timeline by handling scenario where player's participation in elimination of a player is checked. The modifications enhance the visual presentation of event timeline by distinguishing positive and negative events and correctly handling all possible events.

Refactor SetMatchTimeline method in MatchDetail.xaml.cs
Refactoring was done to make the code more readable and maintainable by eliminating code duplications. Instead of repeatedly declaring ellipse and rectangle properties for different instances within different conditional checks, they are now separately declared in new methods such as 'SetPrecedentEvent', 'SetPositiveEvent' and 'SetNegativeEvent', and invoked as and when required.

Refactor MatchDetail view code for clarity
The 'MatchDetail.xaml.cs' file has been refactored for readability and maintainability. Unnecessary loop containing creation of 'StartStackPanel' was eliminated. Now this panel is created only once before iterating over 'timelineInfoFrame.Events'. The change simplifies the structure of the code, making it easier to understand and manage.

Update stats calculation and layout in MatchDetail
Updated the way team damage is calculated in MatchDetail.xaml.cs to show the highest damage dealt instead of total team damage. Also, minions killed now include ally and enemy jungle minions. This provides more accurate player performance stats.
Adjusted layout in MatchDetail.xaml for better presentation of highlights. A new grid structure was added to maintain a fixed position for the "Temps forts" title and avoid it being scrolled with the MatchTimelineGrid. This improves user experience during match review.
Started to change and organize assets
Reformat code and adding best champions

Refactor UI elements in SummonerInfoPage.xaml.cs
Refactored several user interface elements in the SummonerInfoPage.xaml.cs file to simplify code and improve readability. Removal of properties from StackPanel instances, icon borders now nested within ViewBox instances, and propagation of margin adjustments for better visual appeal.

Add summary comments and improve UI element creation
Additional descriptive comments have been added to methods across several classes to enhance the understanding of their functionality. Further changes include adjustments in the way UI elements are created and organized within `SummonerInfoPage.xaml.cs`, ultimately aiming for better readability and maintainability of the code.

Add LiveCharts to NexusClient
Added ViewModel.cs file to implement LiveChartsCore in NexusClient for graphical representation of data. Modified NexusClient.csproj to include LiveChartsCore.SkiaSharpView package. In MatchDetail.xaml, added the ViewModel and a CartesianChart within a new grid to visualize the series data.

Add timeline.json and tidy NexusClient.csproj formatting
Corrected the formatting for the version attribute in NexusClient's .csproj file to maintain consistency. The commit also includes the addition of a new 'timeline.json' file under NexusClient, which provides intricate gameplay statistics and event data for a specific League of Legends match.

Refactor initializing team money collection
Removed the initial zero value from the ObservableCollection for team1Money and team2Money in the MatchDetail.xaml.cs. This change cleans up the instantiation of these collections, making the code cleaner and the interpretation more straightforward. Also, the README file has been moved from the NexusClient directory to the root directory.

Improve UX with navigation animations and additional chart
Incorporated navigation transitions for smoother user experience across multiple pages. Enhanced data visualization on the match details page with new toggle buttons for "Gold" and "Minions" stats. Furthermore, the code was optimized by removing redundant debug statements and unused variables.

Refactor match detail visualization and cleanup unused imports
Cleaned up unused imports in NexusClient and MatchDetail.xaml.cs. Refactored visualization logic and applied formatting for better readability in MatchDetail.xaml.cs. This should enhance code maintainability and improve comprehensibility of the visualization routine.

Add XP chart and toggle buttons in MatchDetail
Implemented an XP (experience points) chart in the MatchDetail UI. Interactions between charts have been improved by replacing the previous buttons with toggle buttons. The logic in the button click handlers has also been updated to reflect these changes.

Update UI layout and add loading indicators
In this commit, a button's name has been explicitly defined, various layout elements are updated, and TextBlocks are now contained within Viewboxes in the MatchDetail.xaml file. In the corresponding .cs file, the display of summoner names is adjusted and margins are added to various StackPanels. Additionally, loading indicators are introduced to improve user experience during data loading.

Update Newtonsoft.Json package and README
The Newtonsoft.Json package reference format was updated in NexusClient.csproj. The README underwent significant changes: fixed a typo, added more detailed software dependencies along with their respective links, and introduced a new "Goals" section.

Add publish settings and clear grid children before loading data
Added publish settings in riderPublish.xml and NexusClient.csproj. Also, added lines in SummonerInfoPage.xaml.cs to clear grid children before loading match data and best champions data, ensuring that old data is removed prior to new data load.

Update account validation and asset paths
This commit updates the input validation in the welcome page to verify the summoner ID in a more granulated way. It also changes the paths of assets used in the application to point to the updated 14.1.1 version of data files instead of 13.24.1, and the Camille.RiotGames API. A fallback is implemented to retrieve MasterLeague data if there are fewer than three challengerEntries.
solved issue with summoner names and v14

MESSAGE.value:
Add summary comments and improve UI element creation
Additional descriptive comments have been added to methods across several classes to enhance the understanding of their functionality. Further changes include adjustments in the way UI elements are created and organized within `SummonerInfoPage.xaml.cs`, ultimately aiming for better readability and maintainability of the code.

Add LiveCharts to NexusClient
Added ViewModel.cs file to implement LiveChartsCore in NexusClient for graphical representation of data. Modified NexusClient.csproj to include LiveChartsCore.SkiaSharpView package. In MatchDetail.xaml, added the ViewModel and a CartesianChart within a new grid to visualize the series data.

Update NexusClient and add timeline.json
Updated the version attribute spacing in the NexusClient's .csproj file. Additionally, added a new file called timeline.json in the NexusClient project. The new file contains data representing in-game events and player statistics for a League of Legends match.

Add timeline.json and tidy NexusClient.csproj formatting
Corrected the formatting for the version attribute in NexusClient's .csproj file to maintain consistency. The commit also includes the addition of a new 'timeline.json' file under NexusClient, which provides intricate gameplay statistics and event data for a specific League of Legends match.

Refactor initializing team money collection
Removed the initial zero value from the ObservableCollection for team1Money and team2Money in the MatchDetail.xaml.cs. This change cleans up the instantiation of these collections, making the code cleaner and the interpretation more straightforward. Also, the README file has been moved from the NexusClient directory to the root directory.

Add new animations and chart for in-game statistics
Implemented navigation transitions for a more fluid UX. Added a new button to toggle between "Gold" and "Minions" chart in the match details page enhancing the data visualization for individual player stats. Streamlined code by replacing debug statements and unnecessary variables.

Improve UX with navigation animations and additional chart
Incorporated navigation transitions for smoother user experience across multiple pages. Enhanced data visualization on the match details page with new toggle buttons for "Gold" and "Minions" stats. Furthermore, the code was optimized by removing redundant debug statements and unused variables.

Refactor match detail visualization and cleanup unused imports
Cleaned up unused imports in NexusClient and MatchDetail.xaml.cs. Refactored visualization logic and applied formatting for better readability in MatchDetail.xaml.cs. This should enhance code maintainability and improve comprehensibility of the visualization routine.

Add XP chart and toggle buttons in MatchDetail
Implemented an XP (experience points) chart in the MatchDetail UI. Interactions between charts have been improved by replacing the previous buttons with toggle buttons. The logic in the button click handlers has also been updated to reflect these changes.

Update UI layout and add loading indicators
In this commit, a button's name has been explicitly defined, various layout elements are updated, and TextBlocks are now contained within Viewboxes in the MatchDetail.xaml file. In the corresponding .cs file, the display of summoner names is adjusted and margins are added to various StackPanels. Additionally, loading indicators are introduced to improve user experience during data loading.

Update Newtonsoft.Json package and README
The Newtonsoft.Json package reference format was updated in NexusClient.csproj. The README underwent significant changes: fixed a typo, added more detailed software dependencies along with their respective links, and introduced a new "Goals" section.

Add publish settings and clear grid children before loading data
Added publish settings in riderPublish.xml and NexusClient.csproj. Also, added lines in SummonerInfoPage.xaml.cs to clear grid children before loading match data and best champions data, ensuring that old data is removed prior to new data load.

Update account validation and asset paths
This commit updates the input validation in the welcome page to verify the summoner ID in a more granulated way. It also changes the paths of assets used in the application to point to the updated 14.1.1 version of data files instead of 13.24.1, and the Camille.RiotGames API. A fallback is implemented to retrieve MasterLeague data if there are fewer than three challengerEntries.
v14 support and started deployment

Optimized leaderboard
